summary: An attempt to make Skyrim look more realistic while keeping your framerate intact ;)
descriptionHtml:
[IMG]http://i1122.photobucket.com/albums/l527/hinti21/Skyrim/Last%20Dawn%20ENB/auraenb.jpg[/IMG]

[color=#FFB6C1][center][font=monotype corsiva][size=6]This mod was designed to work with \'Climates Of Tamriel\', if you don\'t use CoT, the results may not be optimal.[/center][/size]


[center][size=5]This is a mix of different ENB-settings with which I tried to achieve a more realistic looking Skyrim while trying not to let your framerate suffer too much.[/center]


[b]Installation:[/b]


 - Download the ENB-Binaries from this site:
   http://enbdev.com/mod_tesskyrim_v0112.htm

 - Unpack the archive and copy the file ‘d3d9.dll‘ from the 
   ‘WrapperVersion‘-folder to your Skyrim-directory  (where TESV.exe is)

 - Download the mod \'Climates of Tamriel\' from this site:
   http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/download/87548

 - Unpack the archive and copy the file ‘ClimatesOfTamriel.esm‘
   and the folders ‘sound‘and \'textures\' to your \'Data\'-folder in
   your Skyrim-directory  (where TESV.exe is)

 - Now download this mod, unpack the archive, choose a version and copy
   the files from the chosen folder to your Skyrim-directory

 - To get the optimal effects, go to 
   \'C:\\Users\\USER\\Documents\\My Games\\Skyrim\\\' and open the file \'SKYRIMPREFS.INI\'.
   and change these lines in the \'[Display]\'-section to the following ones:
   [i]bFloatPointRenderTarget=1[/i] (you need to have this one for the mod to work)
   [i]bTreesReceiveShadows=1[/i] (this one is optional and is pretty self-explanatory)
   [i]bDrawLandShadows=1[/i] (this one is optional and is pretty self-explanatory)
   [i]bShadowsOnGrass=1[/i] (this one is optional and is pretty self-explanatory)



[center]Credits:
Boris Vorontsov
Matso
superl3
TheRadikal
HeliosDoubleSix
yoon2886[/center]
[/size][/font][/color]
author: hinti21
